1) Addition — Addition of two simple numbers with the help of a bubble shooter game.
2) Subtraction — Subtraction of two numbers by popping balloons and writing answers.
3) Multiplication — Drop apples in the basket as per the given question.
4) Division — Share or split into equal parts.
5) 0 to 1 numbers — Understand zero and one with real examples.
6) 1 to 20 numbers — Number names, order, and counting fluency.
7) 21 to 30 numbers — Continue counting and recognize patterns.
8) 31 to 99 numbers — Tens and ones place practice.
9) Counting — Count forward/backward and skip‑count basics.
10) Shapes — Identify and sort common 2D shapes.
11) Time Measurement — Read clocks and understand hours/minutes.
12) Coins and Currency — Recognize coins/notes and make amounts.
13) Even Numbers — Numbers divisible by 2 with equal pairs.
14) Odd Numbers — Numbers that leave one unpaired.
15) Number comparison — Use >, <, = to compare values.
16) Calendar Basics — Days, weeks, and months on a calendar.
